In advance of a June 2009, court date, ''[[Edra Blixseth]]'' spoke to a reporter for ''The New York Times'' about her and her ex-husband's business affairs from Porcupine Creek, her {{convert|30000|sqft|m2|adj=on}} estate in [[Rancho Mirage, CA]]. She is hoping to retain the estate and make it income-producing with its {{convert|240|acre|km2|adj=on}} private golf course.
The Yellowstone Club has been sold to the private equity firm of one of its members, Sam Byrne of [http://www.crossharborcapital.com/ CrossHarbor Capital Partners] for $115 million. In 2009, negotiations with that same buyer had put a $400 million price tag on the club, but the deal did not close then. In the 2009 transaction, Byrne "has pledged to invest $75 million above the purchase price in repairs and has set aside $15 million to pay the clubâs creditors," according to the ''Times''.<ref name="NYT01" /> The deal was brokered by Jeff Woolson, Managing Director of the CBRE Golf & Resort Properties Group,<ref>http://cbregolf.com/</ref> and Steve Lehr, Managing Director of CBRE's Land Services Group. CB Richard Ellis was selected by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court to market the property because of the firm's successful track record handling complicated transactions.
